intro: Cacalia aschenborniana, commonly known as the Aschenborn's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many species of bellflowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
